title: Mission Description
content: The citizens' assembly on the matter of "Pausing the Flame-Chase Journey" is coming to an end. Soon, everyone will witness what "vote-decided tomorrow" they will experience.Your fifteen Entry Hours are done. The last performance is about to begin.

text: At the same time, in Okhema

speaker: Cerces
line: Time flies... In the blink of an eye, the fifteenth Entry Hour is already at hand.

speaker: Cerces
line: When this farce is over, your soul will be placed on the scales of life and death. Are you ready?

speaker: Anaxa
line: No need to ask so many times—of course I am.

speaker: Cerces
line: Then why do you drag your feet? Is your fear of crowds holding you back again?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Hmph, I simply find them too noisy. Paying attention to conceited fools like them would be an utter waste of my time.

speaker: Cerces
line: Such harsh words. As I see it, you are no less arrogant than they are.

speaker: Anaxa
line: I couldn't agree more.

speaker: Cerces
line: Oh? I did not expect to hear that from you. Are you not going to refute me?

speaker: Anaxa
line: I know myself better than you think I do... At the very least, better than a stowaway like you.

speaker: Cerces
line: And they say men whose ends are nigh have but kind words.

speaker: Cerces
line: Well that is exactly why I chose you.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Hmph, should I thank you for the compliment?

speaker: Cerces
line: The hour of the trial has come. Do you have an answer for me? And... how will you prove the veracity of your argument?

speaker: Anaxa
line: I suppose there is no point in putting this off any longer. Do you recall where we stopped the last time?

speaker: Cerces
line: You were saying that Amphoreus ' history is cyclical...

text: "The galaxy is vast beyond compare, containing an infinite number of possibilities." Our community needs more information on this page! Can you help out? Click here to add more. The reason provided was: Missing animation (Polyxia, Castorice, Calypso and Gnaeus)

speaker: Anaxa
line: Indeed. The demigods that bear the Coreflames eventually become the new Titans at the world's end...

speaker: Anaxa
line: Remember what happened on the holy mountain? Calypso , Gnaeus ... As their destined ends approached, one by one, they left this world... leaving only the twins, who were fated to succeed Death.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Unfortunately, while their journey is consistent with ours — you and Calypso as well as Nikador and Gnaeus act as supporting evidence — I can only come up with a rough sketch for my theory of a cyclical history.

text: "The galaxy is vast beyond compare, containing an infinite number of possibilities." Our community needs more information on this page! Can you help out? Click here to add more. The reason provided was: Missing animation (Polyxia, Castorice)

speaker: Anaxa
line: For all the pains I took to reach this point, I had already lost hope of ever obtaining definitive proof. After all, the past is in the past. Proving that we are the legacies of heroes of the past is a hopeless endeavor.

speaker: Anaxa
line: That is, until I met a girl named Polyxia and her sister.

speaker: Anaxa
line: If Castorice was truly sent from the past to the present for the Titan's self-serving reasons, then having lived through two cycles and with Styxia as the pivot, she will no doubt be the link to connect all of this together.

speaker: Anaxa
line: If the twins of Death can bridge two cycles to reunite at the shores of the Sea of Souls... then my hypothesis will no longer be just a hypothesis, and you, too, will get the answer to your question.

speaker: Cerces
line: That is all well and good, but how can you be so sure? If there is even the slightest error in your hypothesis, the girl will be shattered.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Hmph, it matters not. The most important quality a scholar must possess is foolhardiness. If you are overly cautious, then you'll never have the gumption to make the first step, and change will never come.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Besides, I, Anaxagoras, am destined to overturn this farcical world.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Come, let us go and teach those pathetic worms one final lesson.

text: Head to the Demigod Council and witness the results of the citizens' assembly

speaker: Anaxa
line: Phainon... So, they are leaving the final debate to him.

speaker: Caenis
line: Let those Chrysos Heirs who started this terrible war hear you!

speaker: Caenis
line: Let them hear the voices of the people!

speaker: Anaxa
line: As always, that woman knows how to stir up a crowd.

speaker: Phainon
line: Professor Anaxa...? I thought you'd pass on this.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Everyone must cast their vote, or this assembly would serve no purpose.

speaker: Phainon
line: Prof... Do you truly think it's wise to entrust the fate of the world to an assembly like this?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Okhema has stood strong under this system for a thousand years. It stands to reason that there is purpose in its existence.

speaker: Anaxa
line: But that is not what you're asking, is it? What you really want to know is: Is Aglaea making the right decision in entrusting the fate of the world to you?

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Nothing ever escapes you.

speaker: Anaxa
line: I didn't spend all those years teaching you for nothing. Most people only take four years to graduate, if I recall.

speaker: Phainon
line: Haha... To tell the truth, I feel like I'm on my way to an execution chamber instead of a podium.

speaker: Phainon
line: So... do you have an answer to that question?

speaker: Anaxa
line: No, I don't.

speaker: Phainon
line: I thought so...

speaker: Anaxa
line: Because that question is not yours to ask in the first place.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Is "Aglaea entrusting the world to you" the right decision? Don't make me laugh. That is a question that woman must answer herself. Why are you fretting about this on her behalf? Or have you been seeing yourself as her pawn all this time?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Listen up, I'll say this only once. Flip your perspective around and ask yourself this instead, "What should *I* do to ensure that the world doesn't stray from the correct path?" That is what you should be thinking about.

speaker: Anaxa
line: You still have time, so give it some thought. Oh, and don't bother telling me the answer.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Tell it to those begging for salvation from the gods.

speaker: Phainon
line: Got it.

speaker: Phainon
line: Thank you, Professor Anaxa.

speaker: Anaxa
line: That's Anaxagoras to you.

speaker: Phainon
line: Who... who'll you be voting for?

speaker: Anaxa
line: That'll depend on how well you perform... May Cerces safeguard your thoughts.

text: Speak with the message-bearing soldier and take a seat at the special seating section

speaker: Military Runner
line: Lord Anaxa, you're finally here!

speaker: Military Runner
line: The last speaker for the assembly will be taking the stage soon. The resolution will be passed after that.

speaker: Military Runner
line: Lady Caenis has reserved a special seat for you. Shall I show you to it?

speaker: Military Runner
line: Lady Caenis has reserved a special seat for you. Shall I show you to it?

text: Sit down and listen to Phainon's speech to the public

speaker: Lygus
line: Elders and citizens, silence, if you please. As the Theoros, I present to you:

speaker: Lygus
line: Phainon of Aedes Elysiae , virtuous citizen of Okhema and the last speaker of the assembly.

speaker: Phainon
line: Much obliged, Lord Lygus.

speaker: Arrogant Citizen
line: I remember him — he's the penniless lad working for Aglaea!

speaker: Confused Citizen
line: Where's Lady Goldweaver? Why is she sending this guy to give the last speech? Is this really the end of the Flame-Chase Journey?

speaker: Calm Citizen
line: Can this dude really face down Caenis...?

speaker: Phainon
line: By Kephale above, dear citizens of Okhema...

speaker: Phainon
line: As you look upon me, so too do I see you.

speaker: Phainon
line: I see your fear and misgivings, your apprehension about the discord between the Chrysos Heirs and the Council of Elders ... and your uneasiness about the future of the holy city.

speaker: Phainon
line: Yet, before you contemplate something as grand as the fate of the world, I ask that you look closer... Look, beyond the horizon illuminated by Kephale , at the crisis threatening to overwhelm us!

speaker: Calm Citizen
line: What...?

speaker: Phainon
line: Aedes Elysiae, my beloved hometown, is a village forgotten by time. It is a place with the most invigorating breeze and wheat fields that spread all the way to the sea... I once thought that there, I would enjoy a lifetime of peace and quiet with my friends and family.

speaker: Phainon
line: How I wish I could invite all of you to that paradise far away from the noise and chatter of the world! Alas, I can't...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Because she... and all that she nurtured... all that I loved... they have long been devoured by the black tide . My beloved home... is no more.

speaker: Phainon
line: I will never forget the day the black tide struck. My father, Hieronymus , fought with a broken sword to his last breath to protect his child. My mother, Audata ... She was ripped apart by monsters, all so I might live to stand before you here and now.

speaker: Phainon
line: Galba ... He was a hunter. But in the end, those arms that once drew a bow instead embraced Piso , his beloved son, as they both breathed their last. Pythias , the teacher, risked her life to save her students, but a burning beam fell on her, crushing her...

speaker: Phainon
line: And what of Livia , her daughter? Did she make it out alive? ...No, she didn't. Livia, Piso, and so many other children... My childhood friends... They were all swallowed by the black tide and turned into monsters.

speaker: Phainon
line: They kept saying the same thing over and over... even up until the final moment I finally steeled my heart and granted them eternal peace with my sword:

speaker: Phainon
line: "Why, Phainon? Aren't we the best of friends?"

speaker: Phainon
line: That is the black tide — a looming threat that can bring Okhema to its knees anytime. Caenis may have promised that, with the Three Titans of Calamity gone, Okhema will return to an Era Chrysea once more, but...

speaker: Phainon
line: Much as it pains me, I must disappoint you: While the demigod of Strife has done everything in his power to hold them back, "they" are still coming.

speaker: Phainon
line: By now, the name of that black-robed swordmaster... the Flame Reaver , has likely echoed throughout the city already. The roaring thunder is a message from the Strife demigod: The Flame Reaver has risen from death, and they hunger for the Coreflames of the gods.

speaker: Arrogant Citizen
line: Lies! If such a powerful enemy is indeed approaching, why is Okhema still a picture of peace?

speaker: Phainon
line: Exactly! The city of Okhema shows no signs of pandemonium or chaos. And why is that? I beg you, spare a moment to think about this. Are we able to stand here and hold this assembly in peace today because the danger has passed?

speaker: Phainon
line: No! This peace we enjoy is no gift of fate. We are able to stand here today only because the Chrysos Heirs have stepped up and shielded Okhema from calamity! With her golden threads, Aglaea has preserved — and continues to preserve — these idyllic days that all of you hold dear!

speaker: Anaxa
line: Heh...

speaker: Phainon
line: The Council of Elders claims that Aglaea will one day forsake the people because her divinity is eroding her body and soul. But ask yourselves this: Rather than offering her aid and support, why do they choose to watch and push Okhema away from the Flame-Chase Journey?

speaker: Phainon
line: The answer that no one can bring themselves to speak of... A truth stained in blood and buried in greed, fear, and vanity... Allow me to lay it bare before you.

speaker: Phainon
line: It is because the Council of Elders, which bears Okhema's history and honor, along with this citizens' assembly we once took so much pride in, are now infested with vermin!

speaker: Angry Citizen
line: You insolent whelp! How dare you—

speaker: Phainon
line: It is true that Aglaea has reached her limit. Why? Because she has been working tirelessly to weave the defenses of our holy city against the encroaching evil — all while these vermin are making up baseless accusations about her and scheming in the shadows!

speaker: Phainon
line: Not once has she ever failed Okhema, yet these vermin attempt to tear her apart, tarnishing her name with unfounded allegations! She may have been blessed by divinity, but hasn't her heart always stayed true to humanity?

speaker: Phainon
line: They attempt to mislead you and reduce this assembly to a crude standoff between gods and humans, but citizens of Okhema! Once more, I implore you to open your eyes and look at those around you!

speaker: Phainon
line: Examine them closely! Beneath all that finery, do you see the good heart of a human... or the poisonous glands of a pest?

speaker: Phainon
line: Make your judgment, then turn your gaze to the demigods whom so many of you regard as cold and merciless — do you not see the light of humanity in them? And those who wear the mask of humanity yet utter only hurtful, slanderous words — can you not see that their souls have been corrupted by power?

speaker: Phainon
line: Yet, no matter what your answer is, and no matter who your vote goes to... rest assured that you have nothing to fear.

speaker: Phainon
line: For Aglaea, Tribios , and I will remain your faithful guardians and pledge our lives to upholding your decision.

speaker: Phainon
line: And this vow will stay true until the end of our days, where it will be passed on to future Flame-Chasers...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...A steadfast and unwavering promise that shall endure through the ages!

text: In an uproar, representative leaders from different cities in Okhema throw pieces of pottery into the dolium...

speaker: Lygus
line: At the present time, on the scales of Talanton , those who call for the continuation of the Flame-Chase Journey and those who demand its suspension...

speaker: Lygus
line: Each faction holds an equal share of the votes, resulting in the perfect balance.

speaker: Anaxa
line: As expected, this is the moment when the Flame-Chase Journey is the closest to its end.

speaker: Lygus
line: And now, it's your turn to vote, Lord Anaxagoras.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Is there anyone else who hasn't voted?

speaker: Lygus
line: No, you're the last. Cast your vote with care, for your decision will break this impasse.

speaker: Anaxa
line: I have long since made a decision.

speaker: Lygus
line: Very well. May you bring much-needed change to this farcical world.

text: Head to the dolium and place the last vote

title: Step Description
content: The citizens' assembly on the matter of "Pausing the Flame-Chase Journey" is coming to an end. Soon, everyone will witness what "vote-decided tomorrow" they will experience.You hold the last ceramic shard that will decide Amphoreus's fate. Where will your vote fall?

speaker: Adult male
line: The last vote...

speaker: Adult female
line: Who will he vote for?

speaker: Adult male
line: Hmph, always the performer.

speaker: Adult female
line: Talk about a grand entrance...

speaker: Adult male
line: Vote for Caenis!

speaker: Adult female
line: The die is cast...

speaker: Caenis
line: I trust you haven't forgotten the world we've envisioned together.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Heh...

speaker: Anaxa
line: You've done well, Phainon. Given the circumstances, delivering a rousing speech to stir up emotions was a prudent move.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Thank you all for your patience. On behalf of the Seven Sages of the Grove of Epiphany and the scholars of Amphoreus, I, Anaxagoras, am ready to cast my vote.

speaker: Anaxa
line: But before that, in the interest of fairness, Lady Goldweaver, I pose a question to you before all who are gathered here:

speaker: Anaxa
line: Will you, as Phainon has promised, stand by the decision made in the assembly, regardless of outcome?

speaker: Aglaea
line: In the interest of fairness... I make no promises, lest it should influence your decision.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Heh, very well. I thank you for your honesty.

speaker: Confused Citizen
line: What's he doing?

speaker: Calm Citizen
line: The stakes are high. Let's be patient.

speaker: Arrogant Citizen
line: Cut the act! Who do you think you are, wasting our time like this?

speaker: Caenis
line: Lord Anaxa, please do not forget that I—

speaker: Anaxa
line: Rule number one: Do not call me Anaxa. Rule number two: Never interrupt me. Silence is golden.

speaker: Citizens' Assembly
line: Just vote already! What are you waiting for?

speaker: Citizens' Assembly
line: Cast... your... vote...

speaker: Cerces
line: I cannot help but wonder: Is every hardship in the world something you will exploit and use to your advantage?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Heh, how else am I supposed to make use of this situation where my body and soul are separated?

speaker: Anaxa
line: O Cerces — or should I say, Calypso — accompany me on this final journey.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Let us journey to the nether realm and see how she will substantiate the answer to your question and validate my decision.

speaker: Anaxa
line: We need only to follow the sound of the tides...

text: "The galaxy is vast beyond compare, containing an infinite number of possibilities." Our community needs more information on this page! Can you help out? Click here to add more. The reason provided was: Missing animation (Anaxa in the River of Soul) (same as in Olive, Cast To the Conference Chair )

speaker: Anaxa
line: You... you are...

speaker: Empedocles
line: Well done, child. Just as I foresaw, you have achieved great things.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Teacher...

text: "The galaxy is vast beyond compare, containing an infinite number of possibilities." Our community needs more information on this page! Can you help out? Click here to add more. The reason provided was: Missing animation (Anaxa and Empedocles) (same as in Olive, Cast To the Conference Chair )

speaker: Empedocles
line: What a twist of fate... A blasphemer raised in the doctrines of the Venerationists. It's like a foal kicking its mother in the belly after taking all her milk.

speaker: Anaxa
line: I respect you immensely, sir, but—

speaker: Empedocles
line: You cherish the truth even more.

speaker: Empedocles
line: So, child, do not be troubled by the criticisms I have borne. Do not let those voices hinder you as you forge ahead.

speaker: Empedocles
line: As the Sage of the Venerationists, I am duty-bound to oppose you. But as your friend and mentor, Anaxagoras, I say:

speaker: Empedocles
line: Go forth, for the truth is already in your hands.

speaker: Anaxa
line: ...I will keep that in mind.

speaker: Empedocles
line: Go now, child. Your lonely pursuit is about to welcome a new chapter...

speaker: Empedocles
line: And when you reach the end of this journey, may we meet again with the truth before us.

speaker: Anaxa
line: You have my word, sir. May Cerces safeguard your thoughts.

speaker: Empedocles
line: May Cerces safeguard your thoughts.

speaker: Anaxa
line: You are right, Empedocles. My lonely pursuit is about to welcome a new chapter. I must be on my way now...

speaker: Anaxa
line: May we meet again with the truth before us, Empedocles.

title: Step Description
content: The citizens' assembly on the matter of "Pausing the Flame-Chase Journey" is coming to an end. Soon, everyone will witness what "vote-decided tomorrow" they will experience.How foolish, trying to decide the fate of the world through votes when the apocalypse looms... Your professional ethics demand that you give these fools an education.

speaker: Dramatic Citizen
line: What are you waiting for? Just cast your vote—

speaker: Anaxa
line: Silence! Silence, everyone!

speaker: Anaxa
line: Behold, Cerces . Here at the center of the world, I shall write the final step of my proof...

speaker: Anaxa
line: For this place is but one step away from the truth.

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: Professor... I completed the proof you wanted.

children.speaker: Anaxa
children.line: The answer is plain as day.

children.speaker: Anaxa
children.line: — The Flame-Chase Journey and nothing else!

children.speaker: Anaxa
children.line: I have deciphered the truth of this world —

speaker: Lygus
line: With the balance shattered, the result is clear. By Kephale and Talanton above, as the Theoros, I have observed...

speaker: Caenis
line: No! Lygus, you can't...!

speaker: Caenis
line: Anaxa! What have you done!? Have you lost your mind!?

speaker: Caenis
line: I hope you are prepared for the harsh punishment awaiting you! Mark my words, I will make sure that clever head of yours never forgets the price of betrayal!

speaker: Anaxa
line: Have you forgotten? I told you, that happens to be one of my rare talents.

speaker: Caenis
line: You put on such a grand performance... just to aid their preposterous Flame-Chase Journey!?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Performance? No, you are quite mistaken. I may be paranoid by nature, but I've always been known for my honesty.

speaker: Anaxa
line: If you really understood me, Lady Caenis, you'd realize that I never had any interest in your pathetic little game of politics. Factions, standpoints... they are jokes in my eyes. I have never once switched sides...

speaker: Anaxa
line: Because I, and I alone, am the truth.

speaker: Lygus
line: Lady Caenis, with all the citizens here as witnesses, we should honor the spirit of democracy and respect the decision of this assembly.

speaker: Lygus
line: ...I have observed that Okhema has chosen her destiny! This citizens' assembly has resolved to continue the Flame-Chase Journey. This resolution shall be put up on the Wall of Heroes such that all citizens are aware of the city's way forward.

speaker: Caenis
line: You...!

speaker: Anaxa
line: It seems not everyone is ready for the assembly to end. Very well, let me entertain you for a little longer.

speaker: Anaxa
line: By your leave, Lord Lygus.

speaker: Lygus
line: Interesting...

speaker: Lygus
line: Elders and citizens, your attention, please! Stay for a moment more, if you will. Anaxagoras of the Grove of Epiphany has an announcement for the assembly.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Just moments ago, all of you made a decision on the fate of Amphoreus. As a supporter of the Flame-Chase Journey, it pleases me to see the choice you have made.

speaker: Anaxa
line: But I regret to say that I still harbor doubts about this outcome. Thus, I hereby challenge this resolution!

speaker: Aglaea
line: Huh...

speaker: Anaxa
line: Tell me, who among you dares swear on Kephale 's name that Era Nova will truly welcome the fairy-tale ending that the Chrysos Heirs have promised? A beautiful new world free of calamity and madness?

speaker: Anaxa
line: No one? Must I pick somebody to answer?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Very well. You, the one acting so wise and profound — in front of all present here, do you dare swear that it will happen for sure?

speaker: Anaxa
line: No? Fine, next. You, the one with ignorance written all over your face... Yes, you. Do you dare swear by it in front of the Titan?

speaker: Confused Citizen
line: What are you trying to do?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Hmph, useless! Your turn, then. With that smug look of yours, you must be confident that the Flame-Chase Journey is the best course to take, right?

speaker: Arrogant Citizen
line: Hey! Mind your tongue!

speaker: Anaxa
line: So, no one? I see. In that case, Phainon, answer me this: Your speech was filled with such passion just now. How confident, then, are you in making this promise?

speaker: Phainon
line: Professor! What are you doing?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Let him continue with his performance.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Haha! Will you look at that? Even Phainon and Aglaea lack the courage to make such a promise!

speaker: Anaxa
line: And what's even more absurd is that no one but I can promise you this new world, and yet the assembly passed the resolution anyway!

speaker: Anaxa
line: But you needn't worry because I knew better than to trust you good-for-nothings. That is precisely why I am here today — to give you one final lecture!

speaker: Anaxa
line: Now, listen up, and listen well! I, Anaxagoras of the Grove of Epiphany, hereby declare:

speaker: Anaxa
line: Everything that the Flame-Chase Journey promises is true! Phainon of Aedes Elysiae, the prophesized demigod who shall succeed Kephale , will reforge each and every one of us in the new world with his complete, intact memories!

speaker: Phainon
line: What...?

speaker: Anaxa
line: The Coreflame-bearing Titans were the Chrysos Heirs of yesterday, and the Chrysos Heirs who carry the Coreflames today will become the Titans of tomorrow.

speaker: Anaxa
line: All of our souls shall endure for eternity in the miracle of the Worldbearer, and all under Kephale's protection shall step into that new world!

speaker: Caenis
line: What!? Are you saying that we must bow down to you and worship you even in our next lives!?

speaker: Caenis
line: Enough, you blasphemous imbecile! How dare you try to deceive us with all these lies and falsehoods! How can you prove—

speaker: Anaxa
line: I told you, don't interrupt me! But since you've asked, I shall be kind and indulge you: My statements are based on my experiments on the divine body of Kephale themself!

speaker: Anaxa
line: You heard me correctly, everyone! With the tacit approval of Caenis and the Council of Elders, I fused my soul with a god through alchemy and learned the truth behind Era Nova!

speaker: Confused Citizen
line: What is he talking about...?

speaker: Confused Citizen
line: Isn't that pure blasphemy?

speaker: Anaxa
line: I, the vile, wretched blasphemer, deserve nothing less than death for my sins...

speaker: Anaxa
line: And the Council of Elders, which granted me consent and aided me in committing this atrocity, should face punishment alongside me!

speaker: Dramatic Citizen
line: By the gods, even Caenis has betrayed Okhema...

speaker: Caenis
line: I—I had no knowledge of his transgressions...! He did that on his own! The Council of Elders bears no responsibility for his actions!

speaker: Caenis
line: Lord Lygus... As the esteemed Theoros, are you going to simply stand by and allow the Council of Elders to be dragged through the mud!?

speaker: Lygus
line: If the accusation is true, I will acknowledge it. If not, my conscience stands unburdened. Lady Caenis, the reputation of the Council of Elders was not built in a day, nor will it be shattered overnight.

speaker: Lygus
line: Repercussions await those who fool the people, and punishment must be meted out to those who abandon their vows. We should respect this beautiful city and her people.

speaker: Caenis
line: You...

speaker: Lygus
line: Lady Aglaea, the Goldweaver, I humbly ask that you take on the responsibility of overseeing this judgment, in the name of the fairness of Talanton and the justice of Kephale ...

speaker: Lygus
line: ...Considering the circumstances, and in accordance with Okhema's Codex, as the only demigod among us, you shall rightfully wield this authority.

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...The honor is mine to bear.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Elders and citizens, silence, if you please!

speaker: Aglaea
line: Anaxagoras of the Grove of Epiphany has made his statement clear. As per Okhema's Codex, I request all present citizens to stand with me in exercising the right of judgment.

speaker: Aglaea
line: First, Elder Caenis of Okhema and Lygus the Theoros stand accused of neglecting their duties and abusing the law, leading to the egregious blasphemy against a god...

speaker: Aglaea
line: In the names of Talanton and Kephale , Okhema is to form a committee before the seventh Action Hour to conduct an investigation and disclose the findings to the public for subsequent judgment!

speaker: Citizens' Assembly
line: Agreed! Agreed!

speaker: Caenis
line: Curse you...!

speaker: Aglaea
line: Now, concerning Anaxagoras of the Grove of Epiphany, he has confessed to grave blasphemy against Kephale ...

speaker: Aglaea
line: In the names of Talanton and Kephale , the accused must be allowed to hear the "people's voice" prior to the execution for a chance at a reduced sentence and possible pardon!

speaker: Citizens' Assembly
line: Let him die! Let him die!

speaker: Phainon
line: Professor...

speaker: Citizens' Assembly
line: Let him die! Let him die!

speaker: Citizens' Assembly
line: Let him die! Let him die!

speaker: Citizens' Assembly
line: Let him die! Let him die!

speaker: Citizens' Assembly
line: Let him die! Let him die!

speaker: Lygus
line: What decision will you make, Lady Goldweaver?

speaker: Anaxa
line: Enough with the hesitation, Aglaea. This is not like you.

speaker: Citizens' Assembly
line: Let him die! Let him die! Let him die! Let him die!

speaker: Aglaea
line: Then, in light of the "people's voice"...

speaker: Aglaea
line: O Talanton on high, may you bring death upon him.

text: When you have a chance to make a choice, make one that you know you won't regret.
